page.title: 06A VISIT TO A GOOSTREY FARM
page.content:
{DROMEDARY LODGE FARM, GOOSTREY
Mr Simpson's farm buildings are over 100 years old. They have been handed down through his family since 1879. He has lived there all his life. It is a mixed farm of 300 acres.In the fields he grows potatoes, barley and wheat. All these are sold as cash crops. He also keeps 100 Friesian cows, 70 calves and one Hereford bull. He milks his cows twice a day and each time it takes two hours. The yield is 1500 litres of milk. Every year one cow gives 5000 litres. He has a herring_bone milking parlour. The animals he does not want to keep go to Chelford auction. Mr Simpson gets up at 6am and works a long day.He has three men,a dog,four tractors and lots of machinery to help him. He enjoys being a farmer.
